question.text:
Given below are two statements:

Statement I: RNA mutates at a faster rate.

Statement II: Viruses having RNA genome and shorter life span mutate and evolve faster.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:

options.text: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.
Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
Statement I is true but Statement II is false.

solution.text:
RNA contains 

  • A ribose sugar
  • A phosphate group
  • Purines (like A and G) and pyrimidines (like C and U).

Being unstable, which is due to the hydroxyl group present at the 2'-carbon of the ribose, RNA mutates faster than DNA. That is also the reason that viruses having RNA genome and shorter life span mutate and evolve faster.
